topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.1: Working in Domains or Projects Based on User Type

body.section:
When working in HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade Horizon interface, admin users can make changes that affect a specific project or all projects in the domain.
Project panel -- Changes made though the Project panel affect only the currently selected project. A non-admin can access only the Project panel. Projects are organizational units in the cloud to which you can assign users. Projects are also known as tenants or accounts.
Admin panel -- Changes made throught the Admin panel generally affect all projects within the cloud domain. An admin can access the Admin panel. A domain is an Identity API v3 entity. Represents a collection of projects, groups and users that defines administrative boundaries for managing OpenStack Identity entities.
When working in HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade, you can log in as an admin user or a non-admin user.
admin user -- an admin user can work with the entire domain: all projects, all users. An admin can access the Admin panel. Changes in the admin panel generally affect all projects.
non-admin user -- a non-admin user can work with projects assigned to that user. A non-admin can access only the Project panel. Changes in the project affect only the currently selected project.
In the Horizon interface, you can use a selector to move between the projects.
